info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:02AM PST until February 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches with the higher snowfall amounts at higher elevations. * WHERE...The Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades including Highway 140, Greensprings Highway, Interstate 5, and the Mount Ashland Ski Road. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, at times, due to slick, snow covered roads. Snowfall rates are likely to be greatest, Monday through Tuesday morning when they could reach a half an inch to 1 inch per hour. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Forecast snowfall amounts range from a foot along Highway 140 near Lake of the Woods, to 5 inches at Siskiyou Summit on Interstate 5, to around 10 inches on Mount Ashland. Additional snowfall will be possible Tuesday afternoon and evening. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
